            Bio
            Juan C. Sanchez-Arias(he/him) is a medical
            doctor and neuroscientist working as a Therapeutic
            Area Tech Lead (Neuroscience) at BenchSci where he uses
            his experience in medicine, neurobiology, biomedical
            research, and experimental design to magnify the impact of
            BenchSci’s platform on empowering preclinical scientists
            with the most advanced AI to increase the speed and quality
            of their research. Previously, he was a Postdoctoral Fellow
            in the Division of Medical Science at the University of
            Victoria funded by a Michael Smith Health Research BC Award.
            Juan’s research experience includes investigating the
            cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying brain and heart
            development, neuronal network and synapse formation, and
            onset of inherited cardiac arrhythmias combining model
            organism experimentation, advanced microscopy, and
            computational biology. His other interests include
            pathophysiological mechanisms of human disease, bio-image
            analysis automation, open science, and science outreach and
            communication.
            
            
            Experience
            BenchSci | Therapeutic Area Tech Lead
            (Neuroscience) | July 2023 - present
            BenchSci | Scientist II, Data Extraction
            | June 2022 - June 2023
            University of Victoria | Postdoctoral
            Fellow | August 2020 - June 2022
            Hospital Universitario del Valle ESE |
            Medical Intern | September 2013 - September 2014
            Centro de Estudios Cerebrales, Universidad del
            Valle | Research Intern | February 2014 - July
            2014
            
            
            Education
            University of Victoria | Victoria, BC,
            Canada
            Ph.D. in Neuroscience | January 2015 - April
            2020
            Universidad del Valle, School of
            Medicine | Cali, Valle, Colombia
            Doctor in Medicine | August 2007 - September
            2014
